response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age and Gender", "high", "At 21, young age is associated with higher recidivism risk, especially in males."],
    ["Race", "low", "Race itself is not a risk determinant for recidivism; social factors may be more relevant."],
    ["Arrest History", "medium", "Two arrests, despite no convictions, indicate prior contact with the criminal justice system, introducing moderate risk."],
    ["Physical Characteristics", "low", "Height and weight do not significantly contribute to recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital and Living Status", "medium", "Living alone and never having been married can indicate limited social support, contributing moderate risk."],
    ["Educational Attainment", "medium", "Having a GED rather than a college degree suggests limited educational advancement, which is moderately linked to recidivism."],
    ["Employment History", "medium", "Holding two jobs suggests some level of instability in employment, contributing moderate risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "medium", "Recent marijuana use indicates substance involvement, a moderate risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health", "high", "Consistent feelings of depression over the past month are a strong indicator of potential mental health issues, increasing risk."],
    ["Family and Childhood Environment", "medium", "Growing up in an urban household of four may have exposed him to higher-risk environments, contributing moderate risk."],
    ["Religious Beliefs", "medium", "Lack of a religious framework or belief may remove a potential protective factor, adding moderate risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: At 21, young age is associated with higher recidivism risk, especially in males.
Race itself is not a risk determinant for recidivism; social factors may be more relevant.
Two arrests, despite no convictions, indicate prior contact with the criminal justice system, introducing moderate risk.
Height and weight do not significantly contribute to recidivism risk.
Living alone and never having been married can indicate limited social support, contributing moderate risk.
Having a GED rather than a college degree suggests limited educational advancement, which is moderately linked to recidivism.
Holding two jobs suggests some level of instability in employment, contributing moderate risk.
Recent marijuana use indicates substance involvement, a moderate risk factor for recidivism.
Consistent feelings of depression over the past month are a strong indicator of potential mental health issues, increasing risk.
Growing up in an urban household of four may have exposed him to higher-risk environments, contributing moderate risk.
Lack of a religious framework or belief may remove a potential protective factor, adding moderate risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 2 times but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs between 200 and 224 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and all of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
